target_text: Yes, if you are a qualified disabled veteran and also a Purple Heart recipient, you can request a fee exemption for Disabled Veteran License Plates and instead get Purple Heart License Plates.

input_text: What should I do if I have a nonresident title but it requires notarization?
target_text: If you have a nonresident title that requires notarization but you are registering it in California, you do not need to have it notarized for registration purposes. You can use the owner's signature directly on the title or a bill of sale to transfer ownership.

input_text: Can vehicles valued over $500 be removed for similar reasons?
target_text: Vehicles valued over $500 cannot be removed under the specific provision for low-valued vehicles as stated in VC §22851.2. Such vehicles may qualify for removal under different laws or circumstances.

input_text: What is the California Certificate of Title?
target_text: The California Certificate of Title is a legal document issued by the California Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV) that serves as proof of vehicle ownership. It contains important information such as the owner's name, the vehicle identification number (VIN), and details about the vehicle itself. When correcting any errors in vehicle reporting or ownership, the Certificate of Title needs to be provided as part of the documentation.

input_text: What are the restrictions on using a Vehicle Moving Permit?
target_text: The Vehicle Moving Permit (REG 172) is restricted to movement of an unregistered vehicle by authorized individuals such as manufacturers, transporters, distributors, or dealers. The permit must be obtained from the DMV prior to movement, and it is not valid for personal use by unregistered individual owners.

input_text: What activities can a vehicle salesperson perform?
target_text: A vehicle salesperson is permitted to engage in various activities including selling vehicles, handling contracts for vehicle sales, and supervising the sale of vehicles or contracts for a dealer. Their role may encompass multiple aspects of the sales process.

input_text: Do Year of Manufacture plates require registration stickers?
target_text: Yes, vehicles with Year of Manufacture License Plates are issued partial year registration (PYR) stickers. These stickers must be placed in the auxiliary sticker well of the vehicle, as they should not be affixed directly to the license plate.

input_text: Is it enough for a dealer to submit documents online for exporting a vehicle after getting the title?
target_text: No, the dealer must appear in person at the DMV with the title and REG 32 form; online submissions are not sufficient for this process.

input_text: What is a shuttle craft?
target_text: A shuttle craft is a full-size, open bow, jet boat similar in function to a barge. It is powered and steered by a personal watercraft. Because of its design and propulsion, it requires registration in California.

input_text: Can I get a title for a vehicle I buy to use on private property?
target_text: Yes, if you want to title the vehicle that is sold for exclusive use on private property, you’ll need to complete the REG 51 form marking it for private property use, and also fill out a REG 256 to explain how the vehicle was moved. You must submit these forms along with the transfer application.

input_text: Do I need to do anything special to apply for a metal tab for a station wagon?
target_text: Yes, you need to ensure that your station wagon is commercially registered and that you apply through the appropriate channels at the DMV for the issuance of special license plates along with the corresponding metal tab.

input_text: What information do I need to provide when updating my address?
target_text: When updating your address, you need to provide the following information: your name and new address as the lienholder, the vehicles to be updated (listed by make, license plate number, and vehicle identification number or VIN), and the names of the registered owners of those vehicles.

input_text: Are there any restrictions on the types of vehicles that can receive HAM License Plates?
target_text: Yes, the main restriction is that Amateur Radio License Plates cannot be issued for trailers. They are exclusively for passenger motor vehicles, commercial vehicles, or motorcycles registered to the holder of an unexpired Amateur Radio Station license.

input_text: What is a park trailer?
target_text: A park trailer is specifically designed for human habitation, meant for recreational or seasonal use. It must have a gross floor area of 400 square feet or less, excluding loft space, and should meet certain construction standards.

input_text: Can vessel agents handle registration for undocumented vessels?
target_text: Yes, vessel agents are authorized to accept registration and transfer applications specifically for undocumented vessels. This allows for the proper processing and documentation of such vessels.

input_text: Are there specific regulations for vessels carrying passengers for hire?
target_text: Yes, vessels carrying passengers for hire are subject to specific regulations, including safety requirements, licensing, and insurance provisions. Compliance with these regulations is critical to ensure passenger safety and legal operation.

input_text: What are the requirements for obtaining Honorary Consul plates?
target_text: The specific requirements for obtaining Honorary Consul plates can be found in Chapter 21, which discusses Special Plates. You will need to consult that section for detailed eligibility criteria and application processes.

input_text: What additional documents are required for vehicle transfers after a foreclosure in California?
target_text: When transferring a vehicle due to foreclosure or state controller sales in California, you must submit specific documents beyond the basic requirements. These include a Verification of Vehicle (REG 31) form if there is no prior California vehicle record, and either a Certification of Foreclosure or a Certificate of Sale from the Controller. This certificate must describe the vehicle by its make and VIN, and include a statement confirming that all legal notification, posting, and advertising requirements have been met.

input_text: Who is considered a self-insurer?
target_text: A self-insurer is defined as a person or entity that has more than 25 vehicles registered under their name and has obtained a Certificate of Self-Insurance (SR 27) from the DMV.

input_text: Are there any exceptions for vehicles needing an SE plate?
target_text: Yes, implements of husbandry are optional for SE plates, meaning they do not necessarily need to display one.

input_text: What does the lienholder enter on line 1 of the REG 119 form?
target_text: The lienholder must enter the word 'REPO' on line 1 of the REG 119 form.

input_text: Do manufacturers of trailers need special registration?
target_text: Yes, manufacturers and sellers of certain trailers, including those sold in kit form, must apply for special plates and certificates in accordance with VC §11701. This ensures compliance with regulatory standards for trailer production and sale.

input_text: What if the vehicle is a commercial vehicle?
target_text: For commercial vehicles weighing less than 10,001 pounds unladen, a weight certificate is required, even if you are only correcting the BTM. If the vehicle weighs 10,001 pounds or more, you will need to submit a Declaration of Gross Vehicle Weight (GVW)/Combined Gross Vehicle Weight (CGW) (REG 4008) form along with the REG 256 form, which should include the estimated unladen weight.

input_text: What happens if the vehicle sold is a commercial vehicle?
target_text: For commercial vehicles weighing less than 10,001 pounds, a weight certificate is required. Additionally, a Declaration of Gross Vehicle Weight/Combined Gross Vehicle Weight (REG 4008) must be submitted for commercial vehicles over 6,001 pounds, except for pickups.

input_text: How can I find out if I owe penalties for vehicle registration or transfer?
target_text: You can determine if you owe penalties for vehicle registration or transfer by consulting the Table of Penalty Dates in Appendix 1D. This table outlines the specific deadlines and penalties applicable to your situation based on the date of transfer.

input_text: What should I do if the first retail customer cannot provide odometer mileage for a rollback?
target_text: If you cannot obtain acknowledgment of the odometer mileage from the first retail customer during a rollback, you should accept a Statement of Facts form (REG 256). This form allows the dealer to explain the situation and note that the mileage could not be verified.

input_text: What can happen if I don't pay my vehicle registration fees?
target_text: If you fail to pay your vehicle registration fees, vehicle license fees, transfer fees, parking violation fees, or use tax, the DMV can impose a lien on your vehicle. This may result in the seizure and subsequent sale of your vehicle to recover the unpaid fees.

input_text: What is the procedure to pay use tax on a vehicle purchased outside the U.S.?
target_text: To pay use tax on a vehicle purchased outside the U.S., you'll need to submit a completed REG 256 form for use tax credit and pay any balance of use tax due after applying any credits. You must also verify the date of actual possession out of state and the date of delivery to a shipping agent or placement in storage for shipment to California.

input_text: What forms do I need to attach when I apply for personalized or YOM license plates?
target_text: When applying for personalized license plates, you simply assign the plate to the vehicle and issue the necessary stickers. However, if you are applying for a Year of Manufacture (YOM) plate, you must attach the YOM License Plate Application (REG 352) to the front of your renewal application and submit it to the Special Processing Unit at DMV headquarters.

input_text: Is it possible to repair a total loss salvage vehicle?
target_text: No, a total loss salvage vehicle is not meant to be repaired since the insurance company or owner has already determined that repairing it would be uneconomical. It is essentially treated as a salvage rather than a vehicle ready for road use.

input_text: What is a permanent vessel number?
target_text: A permanent vessel number is a unique identifier assigned to a vessel by a vessel agent when registering an undocumented vessel. This number is used to identify the vessel for legal and administrative purposes.

input_text: What information needs to be on the California Certificate of Title?
target_text: The California Certificate of Title must display the true full name of the lienholder or legal owner (LO). If either of these names is incorrect or changes, it needs to be corrected on the title and the vehicle record.

input_text: Are wholesale dealers required to have a physical storefront?
target_text: Wholesale dealers are required to maintain a business office; however, they are not mandated to have a display area, a wall license posted, or a business sign.

input_text: What is 'Allocation or Situs County and City' in vehicle registration?
target_text: 'Allocation or Situs County and City' pertains to the specific county and city in California where the vehicle or vessel is primarily used or stored. This is distinct from the owner's residency location, which might be different. This distinction is important for registration purposes.

input_text: What is the IRP and where do I submit my application in California?
target_text: The International Registration Plan (IRP) is a reciprocity agreement among states of the United States and provinces of Canada that allows for the registration of commercial vehicles in multiple jurisdictions with a single application. In California, original IRP applications must be submitted to the IRP Operations at DMV headquarters, specifically addressed to the Department of Motor Vehicles IRP Operations Section, MS H160, PO Box 932320, Sacramento, CA 94232-3200.

input_text: Can I transfer my personalized OTC plate to a new car?
target_text: Yes, you can transfer your personalized OTC plate to a new vehicle. The plate will remain with you during the transfer process as per the standard procedures.

input_text: What happens if one of my vehicles is not registered?
target_text: If one of your vehicles is not registered, you will not be able to interchange the license plates between your vehicles. Both vehicles must be registered and have all renewal fees paid to qualify for the interchange.

input_text: What are the consequences of not having a proper license as a lessor-retailer?
target_text: Failing to secure the necessary dealer or lessor-retailer license can lead to legal repercussions, including fines, penalties, and the inability to lawfully conduct vehicle sales. It may also result in the retraction of the authority to operate as a business within that capacity.

input_text: What types of services can give rise to a lien on a vessel?
target_text: A lien on a vessel can arise from services such as repairs, labor performed on the vessel, furnishing supplies or materials, storing, repairing, safekeeping, costs for mooring, berthing, wharfage, anchorage, and rental charges for a trailer parking space.

input_text: Is there a specific form for registering trailers?
target_text: Yes, the specific form for registering trailers is the Permanent Trailer Identification (PTI) Certification form, REG 4017, which needs to be completed as part of the registration process.

input_text: What can I do if I want a personalized license plate that contains a word similar to one of the restricted combinations?
target_text: If you want a personalized license plate that is similar to a restricted combination, you will need to come up with a different configuration that does not resemble any existing restricted terms or combinations. It's best to consult the list of restricted terms when planning your plate.

input_text: How does the definition of an autoette impact its registration?
target_text: The definition of an autoette directly impacts its registration because only vehicles that meet the specified criteria—including the number of wheels, weight, length, and width—can be registered as autoettes with the DMV. This classification may also dictate where the vehicle is permitted to operate.

input_text: What if my vehicle has a lien from Washington? What happens during the conversion?
target_text: If your vehicle has a lien from Washington, you will need to ensure that the lien is satisfied before conversion. Since Washington issues a clear title when the lien is satisfied, you would then present this title as part of your documentation for converting to a California title, without incurring an additional transfer fee.

input_text: What is a disclosure statement for a Lemon Law Buyback?
target_text: A disclosure statement for a Lemon Law Buyback is a legal document that must be signed by the buyer when purchasing a vehicle known to be a buyback due to warranty issues. It must clearly indicate that the vehicle was returned to the dealer or manufacturer because of defects pursuant to warranty laws, and it must include identifying information about the vehicle like the year, make, model, and VIN.

input_text: Are there any exceptions to the 17-digit VIN requirement?
target_text: Yes, certain vehicles that are incidentally operated on highways, such as special equipment (SE), off-highway vehicles (OHV), and park trailers, do not require a 17-digit VIN. However, yard trucks must have a complying 17-digit VIN to be registered or operated regardless of this exemption.

input_text: How can I obtain the DL 106R form for ORC clearance?
target_text: You can obtain the DL 106R form from the court that issued your citations. Once all ORCs have been resolved, the court will issue this form to both you and the DMV as proof of clearance.

input_text: What if I bought a car from a dealer but I don’t remember the date I took possession?
target_text: If you cannot remember the date you took possession of the vehicle from the dealer, you might want to check the purchase agreement or any documentation the dealer provided at the time of sale, as this documentation typically includes the possession date.

input_text: Are there any exceptions to the requirement of filing a REG 51?
target_text: Yes, there are specific exceptions where dealers are not required to file a REG 51. These include cases where a used vehicle is registered solely in the name of the dealership, or for vehicles like midget autos or racers that are intended for use exclusively by children.

input_text: What documents do dealers need to provide when submitting a transfer application?
target_text: Dealers must provide the dealer’s endorsement on the California Certificate of Title, which includes the dealer’s name and a countersignature or initials. They also need to submit the Report of Sale–Used Vehicle (REG 51) form.

input_text: What happens if I change my address in California? Do I need to inform the DMV?
target_text: Yes, if you change your address in California, you are required to notify the DMV within 10 days. This is important to ensure that your vehicle registration and any correspondence from the DMV are sent to the correct address.

input_text: What steps does a lienholder need to take to request information about vessel owners?
target_text: A lienholder needs to submit an Information Request from Registration Records to the DMV along with the nonrefundable filing fee. Once these requirements are met, the DMV will promptly furnish the lienholder with the necessary names and addresses of the owners of record.

input_text: What is a Certificate of Excise Tax Clearance (CDTFA 1138)?
target_text: A Certificate of Excise Tax Clearance (CDTFA 1138) is a document issued by the CDTFA that confirms that a commercial vehicle is compliant with fuel tax requirements. This certificate is often necessary for presenting to the Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV) alongside the registration or transfer application for commercial vehicles.

input_text: Do I need to go through the state Department of Motor Vehicles to register a Consul Corps vehicle?
target_text: No, you do not go through the state Department of Motor Vehicles to register a Consul Corps vehicle. Instead, the registration is handled by the federal government.

input_text: Where can I find information about transfer fees for vehicle sales?
target_text: Information regarding transfer fees for vehicle sales can be found in Appendix 1F of the regulations. It's important to refer to this appendix to determine the applicable fees based on your specific transaction.

input_text: What are the requirements after a vehicle is removed as abandoned?
target_text: After a vehicle is removed as abandoned, the public agency is required to submit specific documentation within five days. This includes a Notice—Removal of Abandoned Vehicle (REG 104) form, any certificates they may have in their possession, and the vehicle's license plates or a certification of license plate destruction.

input_text: What happens if a vehicle does not have a valid 17-digit VIN?
target_text: If a vehicle does not have a VIN that passes the check-digit validation, federal statutes require the DMV to refuse its registration. This measure ensures that only compliant vehicles can be registered for use on public roads.

input_text: Is there a specific form for requesting a substitute sticker for my vehicle?
target_text: Yes, you must use the Application for Replacement Plates, Stickers, Documents (REG 156) to request a substitute sticker for your vehicle.

input_text: How can I order more REG 396 or REG 398 forms?
target_text: To order additional REG 396 or REG 398 forms, you must submit a request by mail using the appropriate order forms: OL 395W for REG 396 and OL 395A for REG 398.

input_text: What is the use tax situation for out-of-state vehicle purchases?
target_text: If you purchase a vehicle or vessel from out of state and bring it into California within 365 days, you are required to pay use tax when registering the vehicle in California.

input_text: What is the license plate requirement for truck tractors?
target_text: Truck tractors must have their license plate attached to the front of the vehicle. If they are assigned special interest license plates, one plate must be displayed in front and the other must be destroyed, along with the corresponding stickers.

input_text: Is the Statement of Construction necessary for all kit vehicles?
target_text: Yes, for all kit vehicles, a Statement of Construction is necessary as part of the registration process to validate the vehicle's value.

input_text: What documentation is needed for a vehicle transfer after a court order?
target_text: For a vehicle transfer as a result of a court order, you will typically need to provide the court order itself along with any additional forms required by the DMV. It's important to ensure that the order is clearly specifying the transfer of ownership to avoid complications.

input_text: Is the lienholder required to get the registered owner's endorsement to transfer the title of a repossessed vehicle?
target_text: No, the lienholder can transfer the title of a repossessed vehicle without the registered owner's endorsement by using the REG 119 form.

input_text: What must the movement orders contain to qualify for the registration exemption?
target_text: The movement orders must certify that the NATO member is ordered to be in California, and they should identify the applicant, the member’s country, and the applicant’s duty assignment in California. The format of these orders can vary and does not have a standard layout.

input_text: What documentation do I need to provide to claim the tax exemption for my fishing vessel?
target_text: To claim the tax exemption for your fishing vessel, you must submit the owner’s Statement of Facts on the back of the Application for Registration Number, Certificate of Ownership, and Certificate of Number for Undocumented Vessel (form BOAT 101). This statement should detail the vessel's operation related to commercial deep sea fishing.

input_text: Is there a fee associated with getting Arts Council License Plates?
target_text: Yes, there is a fee required to obtain Arts Council License Plates, which must be paid along with your application. An additional fee may be required for renewal or reassignment of the plates.

input_text: Why does the DMV prefer upper case block letters?
target_text: The DMV prefers upper case block letters because they are easier to read and reduce the potential for misinterpretation of the information. Using these letters ensures greater clarity, which is essential for processing your application accurately.

input_text: What should I do if I paid fees for a vehicle that cannot be registered?
target_text: If you have paid fees for a vehicle that cannot be registered, you should request a refund as stated in VC §42230. Make sure to follow the required procedures for obtaining that refund.

input_text: Who regulates yacht and ship brokers in California?
target_text: In California, yacht and ship brokers, as well as 'for hire' operators, are regulated and licensed by the California State Parks Division of Boating and Waterways.

input_text: How can I apply for California Museums License Plates?
target_text: To apply for California Museums License Plates, you must submit a completed Special Interest License Plate Application (REG 17) form, provide registration documents in your name or documents required to register the vehicle in your name, present the license plates currently assigned to the vehicle, and pay the required fees.

input_text: Can I replace my disabled parking placard if it was mutilated?
target_text: Yes, you can replace your disabled parking placard if it is mutilated. You need to submit a REG 156 form to request the substitution and destroy the damaged placard before a new one is issued.

input_text: Is a taxi considered a commercial vehicle?
target_text: Yes, a taxi is considered a commercial vehicle in California. It transports passengers for hire and therefore must be registered as such, displaying commercial license plates.

input_text: What does it mean to release interest in a vehicle?
target_text: Releasing interest in a vehicle means that the declarant, who may have a financial stake or lien on the vehicle, formally relinquishes their claim. This allows the vehicle to be disposed of without further legal hindrance.

input_text: What happens if the California Certificate of Title is lost or stolen?
target_text: If the California Certificate of Title is lost, stolen, mutilated, or illegible, you can still transfer ownership using REG 227. You will need to follow the basic transfer requirements, which include submitting the Vehicle/Vessel Transfer and Reassignment Form (REG 262) reporting the odometer mileage and filling out a properly completed REG 227. If applicable, the LO’s releasing signature for vehicles three model years or older must be notarized to validate the transfer. This process compensates for the absence of the title and allows the transfer to proceed.

input_text: What occurs if I don't claim my personalized license plates after they have been notified ready for pickup?
target_text: If you do not respond to the notifications to claim your personalized license plates, after the final 30-day notice, the plates will be considered unclaimed and destroyed. You will need to complete a new application and pay fees to reorder the plates if you want them afterward.

input_text: Where can I find the Statement of Construction (REG 5036) form?
target_text: You can obtain the Statement of Construction (REG 5036) form from the California Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV) website or by visiting a local DMV office. Ensure to have the form completed before you proceed with the registration of your specially constructed OHV.

input_text: What is classified as a motor truck?
target_text: A motor truck is defined as a motor vehicle that is specifically designed, used, or maintained for the primary purpose of transporting property. This distinction is important for registration and regulatory reasons in California.

input_text: What happens if I miss the payment deadline for the CHP fee?
target_text: If you miss the payment deadline for the CHP fee, you will incur a penalty. It is important to refer to the Waiver of Fees and/or Penalties section of the regulatory framework for any potential waivers or reductions that may apply to your situation.

input_text: Are there any exemptions for use tax on OHVs?
target_text: The knowledge text does not mention specific exemptions for use tax on OHVs, so it is advisable to refer to Chapter 4 or consult with the relevant tax authority for information on any potential exemptions or specific circumstances that may apply.

input_text: Is there a different fee for processing a lien sale for a vessel and trailer?
target_text: Yes, when processing a lien sale for both a vessel and trailer, the cost cannot exceed $125.

input_text: What is the Quagga and Zebra Mussel Infestation Prevention Fee?
target_text: The Quagga and Zebra Mussel Infestation Prevention Fee, often referred to as the Mussel Fee, is a fee charged for vessels that are used in fresh water in California. This fee is aimed at preventing the spread of invasive mussels that can cause significant ecological and economic damage.

input_text: What is the registration process for a modular mover?
target_text: The registration process for a modular mover typically involves submitting required documentation to the appropriate state agency, paying any applicable fees, and obtaining it an SE plate. Make sure to complete this process before attempting to use the vehicle commercially.

input_text: Can private parties conduct lien sales on abandoned vehicles?
target_text: Private parties cannot use the lien sale process for vehicles unless they are in the business of providing vehicle repairs, towing, or storage and are legally entitled to compensation that has not been received.

input_text: What qualifies as a sale by a lessor-retailer?
target_text: A sale by a lessor-retailer is defined as the transaction where a lessor or renter sells a vehicle that has previously been leased or rented out to the public. This type of sale must comply with all relevant licensing and regulatory frameworks.

input_text: Can I register a boat if my property taxes are delinquent?
target_text: No, you cannot register a boat if your property taxes are delinquent. The DMV will place a hold on your vessel's registration record to prevent any renewals or transfers until the taxes are paid.

input_text: How long do I have to wait to apply for a replacement if my salvage certificate was issued but not received?
target_text: You should allow 30 days from the issuance date of your original salvage certificate before processing a nonreceipt application. This waiting period is intended to ensure that the original certificate has not been delivered.

input_text: What do I need to do to replace a defective year sticker?
target_text: To replace a defective year sticker, you need to submit a completed Application for Replacement Plates, Stickers, Documents (REG 156) form along with the defective sticker. Once these are submitted, a new sticker and registration card will be issued at no cost.

input_text: Can NATO members apply for the exemption without being present in California?
target_text: Yes, NATO members can apply for the exemption via mail. In this case, it's not necessary to verify the applicant's NATO ID if the REG 5045 form includes an original dateline stamp and initials.

input_text: Do utility company-operated vehicles require OHV identification?
target_text: No, motor vehicles owned or operated by, or operated under contract with a utility company, whether privately or publicly owned, are exempt from OHV identification when used as specified in California Vehicle Code §22512. This exemption applies to vehicles performing specific utility functions.

input_text: What happens if I want to restore a vehicle that doesn’t qualify for special license plates?
target_text: If the vehicle does not qualify for Horseless Carriage License Plates or Historical Vehicle License Plates, it generally cannot be reconstructed or made operable after being dismantled. You may need to seek alternate options, such as looking for a different vehicle that does meet the requirements.

input_text: What does having 'JTRS' mean for co-owners of a vehicle?
target_text: When 'JTRS' or joint tenants with right of survivorship is indicated, all owners must agree and sign to transfer ownership while still alive. Upon a co-owner's death, the remaining owner can release their interest, typically by providing a death certificate.

input_text: What is a yard truck?
target_text: A yard truck is a specialized vehicle designed for moving trailers within freight operational yards. These vehicles, sometimes referred to as terminal tractors or yard goats, are configured to facilitate trailer storage or loading operations.

input_text: Can I get my old personalized license plate reassigned to my collector vehicle?
target_text: Yes, personalized license plates can often be reassigned to a collector vehicle even if there is a database record, unlike regular license plates that may have such restrictions.

input_text: Are there exemptions for historical vehicles regarding weight fees?
target_text: Yes, vehicles that are operated or moved exclusively for historical exhibition or similar noncommercial purposes are exempt from weight fees. This means that if the vehicle is used for these specific purposes, it won't incur weight fees.

input_text: Who verifies compliance for off-highway motorcycles converting to on-highway?
target_text: An authorized DMV employee must verify compliance with CARB regulations for all new and used off-highway motorcycles that are converting to on-highway or dual registration.

input_text: Is there any specific phrasing or format required for the report?
target_text: Yes, the report must include the phrase 'sold through' and adhere to a specific layout that captures all required details in an organized manner to ensure clarity and compliance.

input_text: What steps should I take to correct information on the title if my lender has it?
target_text: If your lender has the title and you need to correct information, first ensure you have the required supporting documents, including either the REG 31 or REG 256 form. Then collect any applicable fees and mail the required documentation, including a return envelope, to the lienholder or follow their specific instructions for submission.

input_text: What happens if I don't have my license but need to apply for replacement plates?
target_text: If you do not have a California driver's license or an out-of-state ID, you must present an acceptable secondary photo ID. If you cannot provide any required identification, they cannot accept your REG 156 application.

input_text: What is the timeframe in which interested parties must be notified of a vehicle removal?
target_text: The public agency or lienholder must notify all interested parties of the intent to dispose of the vehicle within 48 hours of its removal, excluding weekends and holidays. This notification should be sent via first-class or certified mail.

input_text: What could happen if I provide registration services without a license?
target_text: Providing registration services without a necessary license or permit is unlawful and can result in penalties, including fines or legal repercussions.

input_text: Who is eligible to apply for Pearl Harbor Survivor License Plates?
target_text: To be eligible for Pearl Harbor Survivor License Plates, the applicant must have been a member of the Armed Forces who was stationed at Pearl Harbor, on the Island of Oahu, or within three miles offshore on December 7, 1941, from 7:55 a.m. to 9:45 a.m. Hawaii time, and must have received an honorable discharge from the military service.

input_text: What is the difference between the registration card and the California Certificate of Title?
target_text: The registration card is issued to the registered owner and provides proof of registration, while the California Certificate of Title is issued to either the legal owner/lienholder or the registered owner if there is no lienholder. The Certificate of Title establishes legal ownership of the vehicle.

input_text: Is it possible to apply for goldenrod registration without submitting a REG 256?
target_text: No, it is not possible to apply for goldenrod registration without submitting a REG 256. The completed REG 256 is a mandatory requirement for the application process, and omitting it would likely delay or invalidate your application.

input_text: What are the requirements for a family member signing on behalf of a military owner?
target_text: When a family member signs the registration application for a military owner, the signature must be countersigned by the relative who is signing. Additionally, the relative must indicate their relationship to the military member on the application to ensure proper verification.

input_text: Can a dealer export a vehicle without having the title in their name?
target_text: No, a dealer must have the title in the name of the dealership to export a vehicle. Without this title, the export process cannot proceed.

input_text: What should I do if I receive a parking citation that I believe is not mine?
target_text: If you believe a parking citation is erroneously issued to you, you must resolve the claim directly with the parking agency that issued the citation. The DMV cannot remove a citation from your record without a release from the parking agency or payment of the fine.

input_text: What is required to apply for Original Sequential Kids License Plates?
target_text: To apply for Original Sequential Kids License Plates in California, you must submit a completed Special Recognition License Plate Application (REG 17A) form, the vehicle's registration in your name or the necessary documents to register the vehicle to you, the license plates currently assigned to the vehicle, and the applicable fees.

input_text: Who can place a lien on a vehicle?
target_text: Anyone who has provided services related to the vehicle, such as repairs, towing, or storage, can place a lien on it if they have not been compensated for those services. This includes mechanics, towing companies, and storage facilities.

input_text: What should I do if I lose my CAV decal ID card?
target_text: If you lose your CAV decal ID card, you can apply for a replacement online through the DMV's CAV decal process. Ensure you follow the specified steps to obtain a new ID card.

input_text: What does it mean that a state is a title-issuing state for boats?
target_text: A title-issuing state for boats means that the state requires a title for vessels, which serves as legal proof of ownership. This process typically involves submitting specific documents to state agencies for approval before a boat can be registered. Certain states listed in the text either do not require titles or have specific regulations on which types of vessels need to be titled.

input_text: Can I use highlighters on important documents?
target_text: Yes, you can use highlighters on important documents, but it's recommended that they be used sparingly to avoid overwhelming the document with color.

input_text: Do I need to go to the DMV in person to export my vehicle?
target_text: Yes, all registered owners must appear in person at the DMV office to sign the REG 32 form when exporting a vehicle to another country.

input_text: Is the process for converting interstate registration the same as goldenrod registration?
target_text: Yes, the conversion process for interstate registration follows the same requirements as the goldenrod registration conversion process. You should refer to the appropriate section for detailed information.

input_text: Are all types of bicycles exempt from requiring an occupational license?
target_text: Not all types of bicycles are exempt. Motorized bicycles and mopeds can be sold without an occupational license only if the dealer does not sell any other products that would require licensure. Regular bicycles that are not motorized would generally not fall under this requirement.

input_text: What should I do if my vehicle doesn’t meet California emission standards?
target_text: If your vehicle does not meet California emission standards, then you are required to submit a REG 31 form during the registration process.

input_text: What is a Direct Import Vehicle?
target_text: A Direct Import Vehicle is a vehicle that has not been manufactured to comply with U.S. federal safety requirements or emission standards as set by the U.S. or California. Such vehicles are not intended for use or sale in the United States.

input_text: What are the requirements for a business to be classified as a wholesale dealer?
target_text: To be considered a wholesale dealer, a business must maintain an office specifically for their operations. However, they are not obligated to display their wall license, have a dedicated display area for vehicles, or put up a business sign.

input_text: Can local ordinances vary by city regarding abandoned vehicles?
target_text: Yes, local ordinances can vary significantly from one city or county to another. Each locality may establish its own specific rules and procedures for addressing abandoned vehicles, which can include the definitions of what constitutes an abandoned vehicle and the steps for removal and disposal.

input_text: What does it mean for a vessel to not be using the waters?
target_text: A vessel is considered not using California waters if it is not physically located in or navigating within the state’s waters.

input_text: What documents do I need to change my address for my vehicle?
target_text: To change your address for your vehicle, you need to submit a completed Notice of Change of Address (DMV 14) form to the DMV. This can be done either by mail or online.

input_text: What happens to my personalized Livery License Plates if I want to transfer them?
target_text: You cannot transfer existing personalized Livery License Plates. Instead, they must be surrendered upon transfer of ownership, but you may apply for other personalized special interest plates with the same design.

input_text: Will I need to show proof of my military service when cancelling my NRM status?
target_text: Yes, in the Statement of Facts (REG 256) form, you must indicate that you are on active duty in the U.S. military service when you wish to cancel your NRM exemption. This serves as your proof of military service during the process.

input_text: Is a manufacturer's brochure necessary for registering an auto crane?
target_text: While a manufacturer's brochure is one option for documenting the vehicle’s design during registration, it is not strictly necessary if you can provide the required forms completed by a DMV employee. Both avenues serve to establish that removing the crane does not leave a cargo-carrying vehicle.

input_text: What information must be included on the weighmaster's certificate?
target_text: The weighmaster's certificate must include the name of the public weighmaster, the license number or vehicle identification number (VIN), the unladen weight of the vehicle, the date and city where it was signed, and a certification statement confirming the weight was accurately measured.

input_text: Why do I need Vessel Carbon Monoxide Warning Stickers?
target_text: Vessel Carbon Monoxide Warning Stickers are important for safety, as they inform occupants of the dangers associated with carbon monoxide, which can accumulate in enclosed spaces on boats. Displaying these stickers helps ensure that all passengers are aware of the risk.

input_text: What documents do I need to register or transfer my vessel?
target_text: To register or transfer a vessel in California, you typically need to provide documentation such as proof of ownership, a completed application form, and identification. Specific requirements can vary, so it's advisable to check with the DMV or an authorized vessel agent for the exact documentation needed for your situation.

input_text: What documentation is required to obtain a TOP for disaster relief?
target_text: To obtain a Temporary Operating Permit (TOP), you will need to submit a Statement of Facts (REG 256) form, which certifies that all conditions for the issuance of the permit will be met.

input_text: What is the procedure if my vehicle is a trailer being registered?
target_text: If you have a trailer or semitrailer, you will need to complete a REG 256 form to certify its estimated weight unless it's being registered under the Permanent Trailer Identification (PTI) program.

input_text: Are all boat sales conducted by 'Vessel Dealers'?
target_text: Yes, all sales of vessels need to be processed through recognized 'Vessel Dealers', unless you are engaging in a private sale where the seller is not a dealer. In that case, specific regulations around retail sales apply.

input_text: Do I need to pay fees for my personalized license plates if I haven't received them yet?
target_text: No, you do not need to pay the personalized license plate renewal fee if the plates are still in process and have not yet been received. You only need to send in the renewal fees for your vehicle license.

input_text: How does a vehicle become classified as a revived salvage vehicle?
target_text: A vehicle is classified as a revived salvage vehicle when it has been reported to the California DMV as a total loss, typically by an insurance company, and afterward has been restored to a condition where it can be operationally used again.

input_text: What happens if I do not include my previous name in a goldenrod registration?
target_text: If you do not include your previous name in the goldenrod registration, it may complicate establishing continuity of ownership when the title is presented later. It is recommended to include both names to avoid confusion and to meet DMV's requirements.

input_text: What happens if my vehicle title has an incorrect lienholder listed?
target_text: If your vehicle title has an incorrect lienholder listed, you can apply for a correction through the DMV. The DMV will cancel the incorrect title and issue a corrected title to the proper lienholder, assuming that the vehicle does not have another lien on it. They will also place a stop on the vehicle record, preventing any further issues until the situation is resolved.

input_text: Can I keep my personalized OTC license plate as a souvenir?
target_text: Yes, you can keep your personalized OTC license plate as a souvenir. The license plate owner must submit a Special Interest License Plate Application (REG 17) marked 'RETAIN INTEREST' and an Application for Replacement Plates, Stickers, Documents (REG 156) for substitute plates. There is no fee required for this retention.

input_text: What information do I need to register a boat?
target_text: To register a boat, you typically need to provide proof of ownership (like a bill of sale), an application for registration, and payment for any associated fees. Some states may also require proof of identity, previous registration documents, or vessel information like hull identification numbers.

input_text: Is there a difference between having 'and' versus 'or' in the ownership names regarding exporting?
target_text: Yes, both 'and' and 'or' require all registered owners to appear in person to sign the REG 32 when exporting a vehicle. The primary difference lies in the ownership transfer upon death, but for exporting, the requirement remains the same for both.

input_text: What happens if a dealer submits paperwork late?
target_text: If a dealer submits paperwork late, they may face penalties as specified in Appendix 1D. The nature of penalties can depend on whether the vehicle is new or used, and the specifics of when applications are submitted relative to the date of sale.

input_text: What penalties might I face if I don't pay vehicle fees after a lien sale?
target_text: If you do not pay the fees after a lien sale within the required 20 days, you may incur penalties. The specifics of these penalties would depend on the prevailing regulations, but they typically involve additional charges on top of the original fees owed.

input_text: What are the requirements for using a bearer bond or note as a title deposit?
target_text: To use a bearer bond or bearer note as a title deposit, it must have a market value equal to or greater than the bond amount required by an admitted surety company. The market value needs to be agreed upon by the principal and beneficiary or determined by a court order if no agreement can be reached.

input_text: Can I get a personalized Veterans Organization License Plate?
target_text: Yes, you can obtain a personalized Veterans Organization License Plate. You can personalize the plate with two to six characters for automobiles, and two to five characters for motorcycles.

input_text: What does Chapter 18 cover regarding vehicles?
target_text: Chapter 18 provides the procedures for selling vehicles and vessels that have liens, as well as for handling abandoned and abated vehicles. It outlines the legal process and requirements involved in these types of sales.

input_text: Are there any responsibilities for a garage keeper regarding vehicle valuation?
target_text: Yes, the garage keeper has the responsibility to estimate the value of the vehicle if the public agency fails to do so within three days after the vehicle's removal.

input_text: When is a bond required for a salvage vehicle?
target_text: A bond is required when regular certificates of title are not available for a vehicle reported as salvage. The bond amount must cover the total payoff to the insured and the amount paid by the salvage buyer.

input_text: Can someone else sign the application for me?
target_text: Yes, a power-of-attorney may be used to authorize someone to sign the application on behalf of the registered owner.

input_text: Are special plates limited to certain types of vehicles?
target_text: No, special license plates can be used on any vehicle owned or lawfully possessed by the licensee, including those used to tow or transport other vehicles.

input_text: When must I pay the weight fee for a forklift?
target_text: You will need to pay the weight fee if your forklift truck is not exempt due to the conditions mentioned. Specifically, if you register your forklift because it operates on a highway for more than one-quarter mile, you must pay the appropriate registration fees, excluding the weight fee if the necessary stipulations are provided in your application.

input_text: Do I receive any stickers or brochures when transferring a motorized salvaged vessel?
target_text: Yes, when transferring a motorized salvaged vessel, you will be issued one set of Vessel Carbon Monoxide Warning Stickers along with a companion brochure. It is important to affix the stickers as explained in the BOAT 3 booklet.

input_text: Are floating homes required to be registered in California?
target_text: Floating homes are generally not required to be registered in California if they are stationary, do not have their own power source, rely on shore utilities, and have a permanent sewage hookup to the shore. This exception allows them to operate as residential dwellings without the need for vessel registration.

input_text: What type of registration do International Traffic Vehicles need?
target_text: International Traffic Vehicles are required to have interstate commercial registration. This means that they must be registered for operation across state lines, acknowledging their role in interstate commerce.

input_text: Where do I apply to junk my vehicle?
target_text: You apply to the California Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV) to record your vehicle as 'Junk.' This process requires filling out the necessary forms and providing specified documentation.

input_text: How can I avoid penalties when transferring vehicle ownership?
target_text: To avoid penalties during a vehicle ownership transfer, make sure to submit all required documents, including the title, any lien release forms, and the necessary fees within the stipulated time frames. Pay the transfer fee within the 30-day window and promptly pay any renewal fees if applicable after the transfer. Keeping thorough records and being aware of deadlines will also help prevent any issues.

input_text: Can I renew my REG 473 after it expires?
target_text: Yes, you can renew your REG 473; however, the application requirements for renewal are the same as for the original application. If more than 20 days have elapsed since the expiration date, you must register the vehicle with full registration unless you can provide a REG 256 indicating that the vehicle was not operated to incur the full fees due.

input_text: Are there any fees associated with the dismantling process?
target_text: Licensed dismantlers do not owe registration or transfer fees when dismantling a vehicle. However, it's important to note that any fees already paid will not be refunded.

input_text: Is a photocopy of the Certificate of Remanufactured Vehicle acceptable for registration?
target_text: No, a photocopy of the Certificate of Remanufactured Vehicle (REG 8) is not acceptable for registration. You must provide the original endorsed certificate.

input_text: Is a smog certification required for all salvaged vehicles being registered in California?
target_text: A smog certification is only required if appropriate for the specific vehicle being registered. It's important to check the vehicle's requirements based on its type, age, and any previous registration details to understand if a smog check is necessary.

input_text: What documents are needed to transfer an exempt agency vehicle?
target_text: To transfer an exempt agency vehicle, you need to submit several key documents: a properly endorsed Certificate of Title, a Verification of Vehicle (REG 31) form if the number of axles is not shown on the title for commercial vehicles, a weight certificate if the weight code is missing on the title, a Statement of Facts (REG 256) form stating the motive power if it's not indicated on the title, and an Exempt License Plate Request (REG 5050) form if transferring to another exempt agency.

input_text: What is a CF number, and why do I need one for my vessel?
target_text: A CF number is a unique identifier assigned to your vessel for registration purposes in California. It helps to track ownership and registration status. If you reregister your vessel when returning to California, you will receive a new CF number alongside your registration.

input_text: What parking privileges come with a Disabled Person placard?
target_text: A Disabled Person (DP) parking placard allows the holder to use any vehicle transporting them and provides the same parking privileges as Disabled Person License Plates.

input_text: Do dismantlers need to disclose the odometer reading when dismantling a vehicle?
target_text: No, dismantlers are exempt from odometer disclosure reporting. However, if odometer readings are available, they should be included if submitted.

input_text: Do I need to notify DMV headquarters for a name change?
target_text: Typically, you do not need to notify DMV headquarters unless there is a specific requirement for special handling related to your application. For most name changes, simply submitting the necessary documents is sufficient.

input_text: What types of vehicles can receive Veterans Organization License Plates?
target_text: Veterans Organization License Plates can be issued for automobiles, commercial vehicles, trailers, and motorcycles. For motorcycles, the personalized plates can have two to five characters, while other vehicles may have plates personalized with two to six characters.

input_text: Does lost mail always mean I can reapply without penalties?
target_text: Not always. You can only reapply without penalties if your application was mailed during the designated penalty-free period and is documented as lost. If it was mailed outside of that time, you may incur penalties.

input_text: Do I need to declare the purchase price during a vehicle title transfer?
target_text: Yes, you are required to declare the purchase price during the vehicle title transfer. If the vehicle was given as a gift or traded, you need to indicate that on the form and, in the case of a gift or trade, provide an estimated value of the vehicle on a Statement of Facts (REG 256) form.

input_text: What happens during the inspection at the BAR Referee Center?
target_text: During the inspection at the BAR Referee Center, officials will verify and/or approve the motive power change. If the new motive power qualifies for an exemption from smog certification, BAR will issue a smog exemption on your vehicle record.

input_text: Can a trustee use a general POA to assign all their duties?
target_text: No, a trustee cannot use a general POA to delegate all their administrative duties. They can assign specific tasks, such as transferring a vehicle, but must provide a restricted POA that is limited to a particular asset or transaction.

input_text: What does the REG 256 form confirm for vehicle registration?
target_text: The REG 256 form confirms that no alterations, adjustments, or modifications have been made to the vehicle’s emissions control system. It indicates that the vehicle has a valid emissions label and meets U.S. and California emission standards.

input_text: Do I need to keep proof of mailing when I send an application to the DMV?
target_text: While the postmark serves as proof of mailing, it is advisable to keep any additional proof of mailing, such as a receipt or a certified mail tracking number, especially if your application is time-sensitive. This can be useful if there are any disputes about the submission date.

input_text: Can nonprofit organizations operate buses without being classified as commercial vehicles?
target_text: Yes, nonprofit organizations can operate buses to transport persons without being classified as commercial vehicles, as long as the bus is not used for hire or compensated transportation. If the bus is maintained for non-profit purposes, such operations are typically exempt from commercial vehicle regulations.

input_text: When does the fee for vehicle registration in California become due?
target_text: In California, registration fees become due on several key dates: the date of the vehicle's first operation as indicated on the Application for Registration of New Vehicle (REG 397), the date when the owner becomes a California resident or takes employment, or the purchase date listed on the Application for Title or Registration (REG 343) for vehicles purchased in California.

input_text: Are there special stickers for competition motorcycles?
target_text: Yes, competition motorcycles are eligible for a specific Motorcycle Transportation Permit (REG 712) which allows for different regulations compared to regular OHV stickers.

input_text: Do I need a smog certification for Foreign Organization License Plates?
target_text: A smog certification may be required for applying for Foreign Organization License Plates if it is applicable to your vehicle. This requirement is dependent on the vehicle's specifications and local emissions laws.

input_text: Where can I find more information about the procedures for incorrect stickers?
target_text: For more information about the procedures regarding incorrect stickers, you can refer to the Accounting Manual, which provides detailed guidelines on handling such situations.

input_text: Is there any specific action needed for license plates when a dealer exports a vehicle?
target_text: Yes, the dealer must ensure that the license plates are removed and submitted to the DMV as part of the export process.

input_text: How do I transfer an amphibious vehicle with dual registration?
target_text: To transfer an amphibious vehicle with dual registration, you will need to submit separate applications for both the vehicle and vessel transfer. For the vehicle transfer, follow the usual vehicle transfer requirements, and for the vessel transfer, you must enter the vehicle license number in the upper-left corner of the Certificate of Number and provide the applicant with the BOAT 3 booklet.

input_text: Can a lienholder change their address for a vehicle registration?
target_text: Yes, a lienholder can change their address by submitting a request on their business letterhead. This letter must clearly state, 'This is a request of legal owner change of address' and include all necessary information as required on the DMV 14 form.

input_text: Who is eligible to submit the Application for Unobtainable Title Certification?
target_text: Only insurance companies are eligible to submit the Application for Unobtainable Title Certification for the issuance of a nonrepairable vehicle certificate under the specified conditions.

input_text: What types of brake and light adjustment certificates are needed for a revived junk vehicle?
target_text: You need to provide either a Certificate of Compliance or a Certificate of Adjustment for both brake and light adjustments. The specific versions accepted depend on their issue dates, with certificates issued after November 29, 2015 considered invalid. Furthermore, if an official station is not available nearby, a Statement of Facts from a repair shop about the working order of brakes and lights may be accepted.

input_text: What happens after I die regarding the TOD beneficiary?
target_text: Upon your death, the ownership of the vehicle or vessel can be transferred to the TOD beneficiary. The beneficiary must submit the California Certificate of Title, sign on the owner's line, and complete a Statement of Facts (REG 256) form that states your date and place of death and affirms their entitlement to the vehicle.

input_text: What are the different types of Disabled Person parking placards?
target_text: There are several types of Disabled Person (DP) parking placards: 1. **Temporary DP Parking Placard**: Valid for up to 180 days for persons with temporary disabilities. 2. **Permanent DP Parking Placard**: Issued for two years for persons with permanent disabilities, expiring on June 30 of odd-numbered years. Only one permanent placard can be held at a time, with a limit of four substitute placards during a two-year renewal period. 3. **Disabled DP Plates**: Only assigned to vehicles registered in the name of a qualified person with a permanent disability. 4. **Travel DP Parking Placard for California Residents**: Valid for 30 days for those with a California permanent DP placard. 5. **Travel DP Parking Placard for Nonresidents**: Valid for up to 90 days for disabled travelers in California.

input_text: Do yacht brokers own the yachts they sell?
target_text: No, yacht brokers do not own the yachts they negotiate for. Their primary function is to assist in the transaction process between the current owner and potential buyers.

input_text: What is the purpose of the courtesy stop on the vehicle record?
target_text: The courtesy stop on the vehicle record serves to temporarily halt any title issuance or changes for 30 days. This allows the dealer or lienholder to take necessary actions, such as obtaining a restraining order, to protect their interests until the matter regarding the omitted lienholder or title error is resolved.

input_text: What is the difference between a substitute plate and a replacement plate?
target_text: A substitute license plate is issued temporarily for special license plates, while a replacement plate is issued as a permanent replacement for lost or damaged standard plates. Substitute plates are specifically for certain types of special plates and allow continued use of a vehicle while the original plate issue is being processed.

input_text: Do all co-owners need to be present to export the vehicle?
target_text: Yes, all registered co-owners whose names appear on the vehicle title must appear in person at the DMV to sign the Certification of Exportation (REG 32). If there is a specific way the names are joined—like 'and' or '/'—it requires all owners to be present.

input_text: How is the identification of NATO members verified during the exemption application?
target_text: When applying in person, the identification, consisting of the NATO member's ID card and movement orders, must be verified against the REG 5046 form. This involves ensuring that the documents contain the necessary identification details like the member's name, service details, and assignment to duty in California.

input_text: What happens if someone acts as a registration service without the required license?
target_text: If someone acts as a registration service without a valid license or temporary permit issued by the DMV, they are in violation of California Vehicle Code regulations. This can lead to penalties, including fines and possible legal action, as it undermines the regulation of vehicle registration activities in the state.

input_text: Can I submit multiple applications with copies of the information like make and model?
target_text: Yes, if you are submitting multiple applications, repetitive information such as the make, year, and model can be a copy. However, it is important to note that critical information, particularly the last digits of the vehicle identification number and signatures, must be provided as originals.

input_text: Can the DV License Plates be transferred to another owner?
target_text: Yes, the DV License Plates remain with the owner, and the transfer of ownership can be processed as usual. You must refer to Chapter 11 for specific transfer procedures.

input_text: Is there a weight fee exemption for vehicles registered to disabled persons?
target_text: Yes, one commercial vehicle with an unladen weight of 8,000 pounds or less that is registered to a disabled person and displays Disabled Person License Plates is exempt from weight fees. This helps support the mobility of disabled individuals.

input_text: What can brokers who are authorized as vessel agents do?
target_text: Authorized brokers can collect both registration fees and the use tax that is due from the buyer during the transaction when selling a yacht or ship.

input_text: Can a vehicle registered to a trust have Disabled Person License Plates?
target_text: Yes, Disabled Person License Plates can be issued for vehicles registered to a trust as long as the applicant's full name appears as part of the trust name or as a trustee. This includes examples like 'Mary Smith Trust' or 'Mary Smith Trustee'.

input_text: What is a 50-State Vehicle?
target_text: A 50-State Vehicle is a vehicle that has been manufactured to meet both U.S. EPA and California emission and safety standards. Because of this certification, it can be registered in California without any restrictions on the odometer mileage.

input_text: How long does a vehicle owner have to apply for a salvage certificate after retaining a salvage vehicle?
target_text: The vehicle owner is required to apply for a salvage certificate within 10 days from the settlement of the total loss.

input_text: What should I do if my registration sticker was placed on the wrong vehicle?
target_text: If your registration sticker was placed on the wrong vehicle, you need to turn in all incorrect or mutilated stickers for destruction. This ensures that the incorrect stickers are properly handled and that your vehicle's registration information is accurate.

input_text: Who gets a Certificate of Title for an OHV?
target_text: A California Certificate of Title is issued solely to off-highway vehicles (OHVs) that are being dual registered. This certification is necessary to prove ownership in cases of vehicles suitable for both off-highway and on-water operation.

input_text: Can any document be notarized?
target_text: Not all documents can be notarized. Documents that are against public policy, require an oath, or involve the notary's personal interest are generally not eligible for notarization. Additionally, certain documents may have specific regulations governing their notarization.

input_text: How can a private property owner remove an abandoned vehicle from their property?
target_text: Private property owners can have abandoned vehicles removed by complying with VC §22658, which requires certain qualifications and adherence to the statute. If the vehicle is removed, the towing company may then conduct a lien sale per CC §§3067-3074.

input_text: What documentation do I need for a use tax refund claim?
target_text: To claim a refund for use tax, you need to complete a REG 256 form and attach it to your application. This REG 256 serves as a request for a refund from CDTFA. Make sure to follow all guidelines provided by CDTFA during this process for your claim to be successful.

input_text: How does the REG 256 form affect my vehicle registration?
target_text: By filing the REG 256 form, your vehicle will be credited to the county of temporary use for the duration you've indicated. However, it is important to note that this credit only affects the allocation of gasoline taxes and does not have any impact on smog inspection requirements for your vehicle.

input_text: Are there any specific instructions for handling the Certificate of Title when requesting a refund?
target_text: Yes, when requesting a refund, the dealer must ensure that the California Certificate of Title is marked as 'Canceled' before sending it to the appropriate Registration Processing Unit (RPU) at the DMV headquarters. Proper marking is crucial for the refund process to proceed.

input_text: What are the implications if a nonresident does not have renewal evidence before operating their vehicle in California?
target_text: If a nonresident operates their vehicle in California without proof of registration renewal from their home state after the statutory expiration date, they must register the vehicle immediately and will incur penalties if they fail to pay the registration fees within 20 days of that expiration date.

input_text: Where do I need to send my application for replacement license plates or ID cards?
target_text: You must forward your application for replacement license plates or ID cards to the Special Processing Unit (SPU) at DMV headquarters.

input_text: Where can manufacturers apply for 17-position VIN assignments?
target_text: Manufacturers of vehicles that are incidentally operated on highways can apply for 17-position VIN assignments through the Society of Automotive Engineers. They can contact the SAE at their headquarters in Warrendale, PA, or via their official website or phone contacts provided for assistance with VIN assignments.

input_text: How can I exchange my Olympic Games license plate for another special license plate?
target_text: To exchange your Olympic Games license plate for another special plate in the same configuration, you need to fill out a REG 17 requesting the exchange and pay the appropriate special license plate fee.

input_text: How do I get a new PTI license plate for my trailer?
target_text: If you request a new PTI license plate, the Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV) will issue it to you. Additionally, you will receive a PTI identification card in lieu of a regular registration card.

input_text: Where should I place the carbon monoxide warning stickers?
target_text: The carbon monoxide warning stickers should be placed in visible locations on your vessel as guided by the instructions in the ABCs of California Boating (BOAT 3) booklet. This ensures that all passengers and users are aware of the dangers associated with carbon monoxide.

input_text: Can a disabled person use their vehicle for business if it has DP License Plates?
target_text: No, Disabled Person License Plates cannot be issued for vehicles used by a disabled person in a street vending business operation. They are specifically intended for transportation purposes that cater exclusively to the needs of disabled persons.

input_text: What are the obligations of a licensed remanufacturer dealer?
target_text: Licensed remanufacturer dealers must comply with several regulations: they are required to report sales of remanufactured vehicles using the Certificate of Remanufactured Vehicle (REG 8) form, which they must request in writing from the DMV. They must also verbally inform the buyer that the vehicle has been remanufactured and provide a notice stating, 'This vehicle has been remanufactured and contains used or reconditioned parts' in several places, including the purchase order or sales contract, advertisements, and on the vehicle itself during retail displays.

input_text: What happens to the license plates if I sell the vehicle?
target_text: If you sell the vehicle assigned Foreign Organization License Plates, the plates must be surrendered to the DMV, as they cannot be retained or transferred to the new owner.

input_text: What is the Statement of Facts form used for in the vehicle refund process?
target_text: The Statement of Facts (REG 256) form can be used when a dealer is applying for a refund of Planned Non-Operation (PNO) fees that were paid in lieu of registration fees. This allows the dealer to formally request a refund for these fees.

input_text: Will I receive license plates or stickers with an Incomplete Application?
target_text: No, license plates and stickers are never issued on an Incomplete Application, which means that you will need to ensure your application is complete before receiving any plates or stickers.

input_text: Is military equipment operated by the National Guard classified as a commercial vehicle?
target_text: Military equipment operated by noncivilian personnel and owned or operated by the U.S. Department of Defense, including the National Guard, is not classified as a commercial vehicle.

input_text: What should I do if I have a military address and need to register a vehicle?
target_text: If you have a military address, you need to complete a REG 256 form, which provides your residence county and city. This form is necessary for determining the proper use tax rate applicable to your situation.

input_text: What types of kit vehicles are there?
target_text: Kit vehicles can vary widely. They often replicate well-known classic cars but can also include commercial vehicles and trailers.

input_text: Will I need to provide reasons for the value discrepancy when correcting an under-reported vehicle value?
target_text: No, you will not be asked why the value was reported incorrectly when correcting an under-reported vehicle value. The focus is on submitting the correct documentation to amend the vehicle record.

input_text: Can the DMV use abbreviations for my name or address?
target_text: Yes, the DMV will use appropriate abbreviations for both names and addresses if they exceed the system's space limitations. They may also split names or addresses across multiple lines to fit the format.

input_text: What is the significance of the 62 percent conversion ratio?
target_text: The 62 percent conversion ratio is essential for accurately reflecting mileage when converting from kilometers to miles after an odometer replacement. It ensures that the mileage reported aligns with the legal and common standards, maintaining integrity in vehicle records.

input_text: What types of transactions are exempt from the compliance checks?
target_text: Transactions that are exempt from the compliance checks include title replacement, plate and sticker replacement, registration replacement, and metal tab replacement, provided there are no renewal fees due.

input_text: What do I need to register my vehicle in California while living out of state?
target_text: To register your vehicle in California from out of state, you must submit the documentation listed in the Basic Registration Requirements section, a vehicle verification completed by a peace officer from your current state, and complete a REG 256 form certifying your California residency and emission standards.

input_text: What if I only have a photocopy of the registration card?
target_text: If you only have a photocopy of the expired registration card, your application will be processed as an original registration transaction. You will still need to provide the completed Application for Title or Registration (REG 343) and a Vehicle Verification (REG 31/REG 343).

input_text: What is meant by 'significant limitation in the use of lower extremities'?
target_text: A 'significant limitation in the use of lower extremities' refers to a considerable reduction in a person's ability to walk, run, or engage in typical movements using their legs or feet. This could be due to an injury, medical condition, or other physical issues that restrict normal leg function.

input_text: What happens to the title fee for ELT lienholders associated with PTI trailers?
target_text: For ELT lienholders associated with PTI trailers, a paper title will not be printed immediately. However, the title fee is still required because a paper title will eventually be issued.

input_text: Are weight fee schedules the same in every state?
target_text: No, weight fee schedules can vary by state. Each state has its own regulations and fee structures for vehicle registration, meaning that what applies in one state may differ in another. It's important to check the specific provisions applicable in your state to ensure compliance and understanding of the applicable fees.

input_text: What constitutes a California Vehicle?
target_text: A California Vehicle is one that is specifically manufactured and certified to meet California's strict emission standards and is intended for its first sale in California. This classification allows for registration without mileage restrictions.

input_text: What do I need to register a cab and chassis with multiple bodies in California?
target_text: To register a cab and chassis with multiple bodies in California, you need to provide proof of ownership for all new and used bodies, use tax or proof of tax paid on all bodies, vehicle license fee (VLF) for all body components, a weight certificate or estimated unladen weight based on the heaviest of all the bodies, and a completed Declaration of Gross Vehicle Weight/Combined Gross Vehicle Weight (REG 4008) form.

input_text: How do I get a new month sticker?
target_text: To get a new month sticker, you just need to verify the month of expiration of your current sticker from your registration or vehicle record. Then, you can obtain a new month sticker from the DMV without any fee or additional paperwork.

input_text: What if I sold my commercial vehicle and don't have a weight certificate available?
target_text: If you sold your commercial vehicle and do not have a weight certificate available, you can submit a REG 256 form certifying the unladen weight of the vehicle. This form can be used in lieu of an official weight certificate for the reconstruction of your registration application.

input_text: How long do I need to retain copies of these documents?
target_text: You should retain a copy of the REG 256 form along with the book copy of the REG 51 for a period of four years.

input_text: Can I use the REG 17 form for more than just personalized plates?
target_text: Yes, the REG 17 form is used for both personalized and sequential Yosemite license plate applications, so you can submit it for either type of plate.

input_text: Can I apply for revival if my vessel doesn’t have a HIN?
target_text: Yes, you can still apply for revival if your vessel doesn’t have a HIN; however, you must provide an explanation regarding the absence of a HIN on your REG 256 statement. It's important to be thorough in your documentation to facilitate the revival process.

input_text: Do wholesale dealers need to comply with the same regulations as retail dealers?
target_text: Wholesale dealers operate under different regulations than retail dealers since their business model is focused on transactions between licensed dealers rather than individual consumers. While they must comply with certain regulatory requirements, such as maintaining a business office, they are exempt from some of the regulations applicable to retail dealers.

input_text: What happens if I mistakenly submit a voided REG 396 form to the DMV?
target_text: If you submit a voided REG 396 form to the DMV by mistake, it may lead to complications or delays in processing. It’s best to ensure that you do not send it and, instead, keep the voided form in your records.

input_text: Are all forklift trucks exempt from weight fees?
target_text: No, not all forklift trucks are exempt from the weight fees. To qualify for the weight fee exemption, the forklift must be registered and must not be moved laden over the highways when operated. If the truck is only used for loading, unloading, or stacking and not operated beyond one-quarter mile along the highway, it remains exempt from registration and thus weight fees.

input_text: What does 'any wheel in contact with the road' mean for vehicle registration?
